TopicTitle: do people watch ksp on youtube or other media?

Articles.Content: because I dont really enjoy watching ksp on youtube. i much more enjoy playing the game but i know there are ksp videos on youtube that get lots of views and sometimes i watch them. personally i much more like watching ksp content on reddit or the forums. but how many of yall do actually watch ksp on youtube and what ksp related content do you watch?

Just now, jastrone said:

because I dont really enjoy watching ksp on youtube. i much more enjoy playing the game but i know there are ksp videos on youtube that get lots of views and sometimes i watch them. personally i much more like watching ksp content on reddit or the forums. but how many of yall do actually watch ksp on youtube and what ksp related content do you watch?

Youtube is number one, Reddit is a distant second, and Discord and even further third.

10 minutes ago, AtomicTech said:

Youtube is number one, Reddit is a distant second, and Discord and even further third.

wich youtubers? what type of videos?

33 minutes ago, jastrone said:

wich youtubers? what type of videos?

For me, Matt Lowne and Orb8ter.  And at that, it's primarily tutorials so I can see what I'm missing in my own knowledge and then try to incorporate that into my game playing.

53 minutes ago, jastrone said:

wich youtubers? what type of videos?

Matt Lowne's entire collection, all of Scott Manley's uploads as well as the ShadowZone, Piolet159, Stratzenblitz, and a few others.

I watch youtube to learn things that I can use.  Watching the experts is mildly entertaining, but i learn almost nothing from them.  Too advanced for me. 

I also learn new things here in the SSTO thread.
I will occasionally look for some specific things on YouTube, but generally don't watch people just playing unless there's a good hook like @seyMonsters hard career mode series.

5 hours ago, AtomicTech said:

Matt Lowne's entire collection, all of Scott Manley's uploads as well as the ShadowZone, Piolet159, Stratzenblitz, and a few others.

danny2462 for a break as well
Except for some tutorials I can't find any reason to see some else playing any game.

8 hours ago, Singhnaut said:

danny2462

yhea if it is one ksp youtuber i have to watch its him.  but i havent watched him lately tho idk why

Scott Manley (duh), although it's a bit old (and I've seen it many many times). It's what got me into the game. 
Also like the beardy penguin's stuff (check out KSP Endurance of you want to see a good USI LS-MKS playthrough). And N9 gaming, he does a RO-RP1 playthrough in collaboration with beardy called For All Kerbalkind.

I watch Matt Lowne's and Danny for entertainment. Scott for information.

I upload my own stupid stuff. Both of my viewers seem to like it.

13 hours ago, Mahnarch said:

I upload my own stupid stuff.

link?  i myself actually upload "my own stupid stuff"
I watch Matt Lowne whenever he uploads ksp content (Otherwise I’m good with his Space This Week series), and I have seen most of The Beardy Penguin’s “For All Kerbalkind” and “Beyond Kerbol”.

9 hours ago, jastrone said:

link?  i myself actually upload "my own stupid stuff" 

I'm not sure if I can self promote here - and I usually don't, anyway - but, I'm 'Narwahl Gaming' on the 'Tubes (as the kids call it).

 

[Yes. I know it's misspelled. That's on purpose - poking fun at me being chonky and having a beard. 'Wahl' being a shaver brand.  ]

I don't watch people just play KSP. There are some good resources on YT, though.

Kottabos Games on YT is the best KSP resource outside of this forum. He's done short reviews of a few hundred mods. Search for something like "Kottabos KSP mods".

While I was still sort of new to KSP, Scott Manley, Matt Lowne, and others had good videos for how to do tricky things in KSP. Now that I'm more proficient I don't need their KSP content. (I still like Manley's real-life space stuff and I'm not sure what else Lowne does.)
I just this morning watched Orb8ter's tutorial on mining.  His attempt at a suicide burn in that video brought tears to my eyes I laughed so hard.
I like to watch live streams. My favourites are JackInABoot and Linuxgurugamer.
Kottabos Games does an awesome review with the planet packs.
I try to as much as possible
